bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, August 19, 1890

div1.p: Lazear writes that he has left Paris after more sightseeing.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, August 19, 1890
div1.p:
We arrived here f[rom]
Paris last night and I hasten to
write you a line before starting
on our tramp down the river.
I was very glad to the letters
on Saturday from you and Uncle
Tom, and also the “Despatch”.
When I opened it a tooth-pick
dropped out.

This place where I am now
is Bâle or Basel in Switzerland
on the upper Rhine. It is quite
a picturesque town. Everyone here
speaks both French and German
as it is near the frontier of
both these countries.

I will tell you more about it
later. On Saturday I went to the Catecombs and on Sunday
to the Louvre and then took
a walk.

I do not call this a letter,
I simply write to let you know
where I am.
